text: In terms of detection sensitivity, EOPM could reliably detect EV71 when >10 6 copies of EV71 RNA were mixed into 10 12 copies of HeLa cell RNA, while 10 3 copies of spike virus RNA could be detected in 10 12 copies of host RNA by specific RT-PCR following agarose gel electrophoresis. Therefore, we inferred that when there was a high level of background nucleic acid, the detection sensitivity of random primer amplification was three orders of magnitude lower than specific primer amplification.
